model_description: This attribute describes how the output of the brain input processing influences the design, the behavior, or the content of the application or experimental paradigm.
example: when the system was confident that the user was in a state of low or high workload, one UAV would be added or removed, respectively. After a UAV was added or removed, there was a 20 second period where no more vehicles were added or removed.

model_description: This attribute describes the algorithmic implementation of the brain signal integration, i.e.\ whether an explicit conditional statement, an Influence Diagram, a state graph, or a different way of behavior modeling was used.
example: [The self-correction algorithm] inspects the probability distribution [\dots] and picks the now highest scoring class [\dots]. [W]e only used the second best class if its re-normalized confidence [\dots] is above a certain threshold T [\dots]. Otherwise, the user was asked to repeat the input.
